page.title: 06BIRMINGHAM CANAL NAVIGATION
page.content: The Birmingham Canal Navigation stretches from Birmingham to its junction with the Staffordshire & Worcestershire Canal at Aldersley. The section between Broad Street Basin and Aldersley is the "Wolverhampton 21" (this section having 21 locks).It can be further divided into two parts: "Town Locks" -Broad Street to Dunstall "Dunstall Locks" -Dunstall to Aldersley The two parts are separated by the railway viaduct at Dunstall and are strikingly different. The urban "Town Locks" looks out on waste land and factory units. It is dominated by the Crown Street Refuse Disposal Plant. The semi-rural "Dunstall Locks" passes Dunstall Park Race Course and quiet countryside near Aldersley. The Birmingham Canal Navigation is now termed a "Cruising Waterway" and is very popular at holiday times.
